smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found. All 19 pages contain at least one element. Each diagram contains classes, tables, use cases, states, or actions.

Examined use case diagrams on pages 2 and 3. Page 2 contains 4 use cases (Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet) with 5 actors positioned around the system boundary. Page 3 contains 7 use cases with 2 actors (Autode haldur, Juhataja). All use case ovals appear to have at least one actor association based on the diagram layout.

Examined all use case names across pages 2 and 3. Use cases include: Tuvasta kasutaja, Vaata aktiivseid autosid, Vaata kõiki autosid, Vaata autode koondaruannet, Registreeri auto, Lõpeta auto, Muuda autot, Aktiveeri auto, Muuda auto mittaktiivseks, Vaata kõiki ootel või mitteaktiivseid autosid, Unusta auto. No duplicate activities describing the same action with the same actor were found.

Examined package diagram on page 1. Packages include: Autode funktsionaalne allsüsteem, Isikute register, Klassifikaatorite register, Töötajate register, Autode register, Klientide register. All element names within each package are unique.

Examined database diagrams on pages 14-19. Columns like 'nimetus' and 'on_aktiivne' appear in multiple tables but represent different contexts (different classifiers). All duplicate-looking columns in related tables are connected via Foreign Key relationships (FK_). No redundant data copies without FK relationships were found.

All use case names follow consistent verb-first naming pattern in Estonian: Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Change), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). All start with active verbs.

Examined state diagram 'Auto seisundidiagramm' on page 9. States: Algus, Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, Lõpetatud, Unustatud. All states have incoming transitions: Algus (initial), Ootel (from Algus), Aktiivne (from Ootel, Mitteaktiivne), Mitteaktiivne (from Aktiivne), Lõpetatud (from Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne), Unustatud (from Ootel). Every state can be reached.

Examined activity diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' on page 4. All actions are reachable from the start node (Algus): Vaata kõiki autosid → decision nodes → Otsi autot, Vali auto, Lõpeta valitud auto → Lõpp. All paths are connected from start.

Examined all class and database diagrams. All association relationships have multiplicity indicators on both ends. Examples: Page 5 shows '0..1' and '0..*' multiplicities; Page 6 shows '1' and '0..*'; Page 12 shows '1', '0..*' on all relationships; Database diagrams (pages 14-19) show multiplicities like '1', '0..1', '0..*' on all FK relationships.

Counted central elements per diagram. Page 2: 4 use cases. Page 3: 7 use cases. Page 5: 3 classes. Page 6: 6 classes. Page 7: 6 classes. Page 8: 6 classes. Page 9: 6 states. Page 10: 5 classes. Page 11: 3 classes. Page 12: 7 classes. Page 13: 3 classes. Page 14: 4 tables. Page 15: 9 tables (Tootaja_roll, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Riik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Auto_kategooria). Page 16: 3 tables. Page 17: 6 tables. Page 18: 2 tables. Page 19: 5 tables. Maximum is 9 on page 15. Threshold is ≥10. Since 9 < 10, smell is NOT present.

Counted visual connection lines per element on each diagram. Page 12 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)': auto has 4 lines (to auto_kategooria_omamine, auto_seisundi_liik, auto_kütuse_liik, auto_mark). Page 17: Auto has 4 lines. Page 19: Tootaja has 4 lines. Maximum connections from any single element is 4. Threshold is ≥6. Since 4 < 6, smell is NOT present.

Visual inspection of diagrams shows elements are reasonably positioned. Related elements appear to be placed in close proximity. No evidence of any relationship distance exceeding twice the average distance between elements.

All use case names start with active verbs (Estonian): Tuvasta (Identify), Vaata (View), Registreeri (Register), Lõpeta (End), Muuda (Change), Aktiveeri (Activate), Unusta (Forget). Activity diagram actions also start with verbs: Vaata, Otsi, Vali, Lõpeta. All names follow active verb pattern.

Examined all class, table, attribute, and use case names. Shortest names found: 'isik' (4 chars), 'auto' (4 chars), 'riik' (4 chars). All names have ≥4 characters. Threshold is ≤3 chars. Since minimum found is 4 > 3, smell is NOT present.

Multiple class names in conceptual class diagrams start with lowercase letters. Page 5: isik, töötaja, auto. Page 6: isik, kasutajakonto, isiku_seisundi_liik, riik. Page 7: klassifikaator, auto_seisundi_liik, auto_kategooria, auto_mark, auto_kütuse_liik, auto_kategooria_tüüp. Page 10: töötaja, töötaja_rolli_omamine. Page 11: auto, isik. Page 12: auto, auto_kategooria_omamine. Page 13: klient. All conceptual class names use lowercase first letter, violating the naming convention.

Examined all attribute/column names across class and database diagrams. Page 6 isik attributes: e_meil, eesnimi, elukoht, isikukood, perenimi, reg_aeg, sünni_kp. Page 14 Isik columns: isik_id, isikukood, riik_kood, e_meil, synni_kp, reg_aeg. All attribute/column names start with lowercase letters.

Examined all database table names on pages 14-19: Isik, Kasutajakonto, Isiku_seisundi_liik, Riik, Tootaja_roll, Auto_kategooria, Auto_kategooria_tyyp, Auto_kytuse_liik, Kliendi_seisundi_liik, Tootaja_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, Klient, Auto, Auto_kategooria_omamine, Tootaja, Tootaja_rolli_omamine. All table names are singular.

Examined all class, table, and attribute names for type prefixes like tbl_, uc_, str, int, etc. Found only allowed prefixes: PK_ (primary key), FK_ (foreign key), pfK (partial foreign key), IXFK_ (index). No disallowed type prefixes were found in any names.
